patterns.name: Sea Level Rise
patterns.description: Cape Cod is experiencing ongoing sea level rise that is projected to accelerate, leading to increased coastal flooding and erosion.
patterns.evidence: Current trends show sea level rising at 3mm per year along Cape Cod's coast. Mid-century projections indicate: 0.5-1.0 feet of rise by 2050, increased coastal flooding frequency, enhanced erosion of barrier beaches.

patterns.name: Coastal Flooding
patterns.description: Storm surge flooding poses growing risks to Cape Cod, with expanding flood zones, more frequent moderate floods, and vulnerable low-lying infrastructure.
patterns.evidence: Storm surge flooding presents increasing risks: Current 100-year flood zones expanding, more frequent moderate flooding events, infrastructure vulnerability in low-lying areas.

patterns.name: Coastal Erosion
patterns.description: Cape Cod's shoreline is eroding at an average rate of 2-3 feet per year, with accelerated loss at certain hotspots threatening the barrier beach system.
patterns.evidence: Shoreline change analysis indicates: Average erosion rates of 2-3 feet per year, accelerating loss at coastal hotspots, barrier beach system vulnerability.

patterns.name: Increasing Projection Uncertainty
patterns.description: While current climate trends in Cape Cod are clear, confidence in projections decreases when looking further out to mid-century and especially late-century.
patterns.evidence: High confidence in current trends, medium confidence in mid-century projections, lower confidence in late-century estimates.
